sentences.en: A winner must be firm and posess strong stamina and inordinate courage.
sentences.cn: 成功者是需要坚韧的毅力和非凡的勇气的.

sentences.en: Accelerating interest rates has caused an inordinate number of loan defaults.
sentences.cn: 加速上升的利率引起了过多数量的贷款拖欠.

sentences.en: An inordinate proportion of the book is given over to quotations.
sentences.cn: 这本书的很大一部分内容是引用的.

sentences.en: He also one of those with an inordinate capacity for extracting enjoyment from all and sundry.
sentences.cn: 他也是那种拥有无限力量从所有的人那里获取欢乐的一种人.

sentences.en: I spent an inordinate amount of time there , working continuously for hours, and my mother worried.
sentences.cn: 我经常在那儿呆很久, 一学就是几个小时.

sentences.en: Individual incentives should reward long - term success, prevent short - termist excesses and punish inordinate risk - taking.
sentences.cn: 个人激励应奖励 长期 成就, 避免短视的过度行为,并对无节制的冒险予以惩罚.

sentences.en: Inordinate desire is at the root of all evils.
sentences.cn: 无节制的欲望是一切罪恶的根源.

sentences.en: Inordinate seeking, only will make own - self sink into suffering abyss.
sentences.cn: 过度的追逐, 只有自陷于痛苦的深渊.

sentences.en: James hints that his heroine's demands on life are inordinate.
sentences.cn: 詹姆斯暗示他的女主人公对于人生过于苛求.

sentences.en: Last, subsidies put an inordinate strain on the budget.
sentences.cn: 最后, 补贴给财政预算造成过大压力.

sentences.en: She always spent an inordinate length of time in the bathroom.
sentences.cn: 她总是要在浴室里呆上好久.

sentences.en: She had an inordinate fondness for candy.
sentences.cn: 她喜欢吃糖果到了无节制的程度.

sentences.en: Testing is taking up an inordinate amount of teachers’ time.
sentences.cn: 测验占去了教师们太多的时间。

sentences.en: The girl has inordinate passion for music.
sentences.cn: 这个女孩过分喜爱音乐.

sentences.en: The idea of this gave me inordinate pleasure.
sentences.cn: 我想到这一点感到非常高兴.

sentences.en: Their pride seems to be more inordinate for their modesty.
sentences.cn: 他们的骄傲似乎因为他们的谦逊而更加咄咄逼人.

sentences.en: They spend an inordinate amount of time talking.
sentences.cn: 他们聊天时间长得超乎想像。

words.tran_cn: 过度的；无节制的；紊乱的

trans.tran_cn: 过度的，无节制的，紊乱的，奢
trans.tran_en: far more than you would reasonably or normally expect
